website_summaries.verdict: It's expensive, but the arc design looks great and has a finish that'll match Microsoft Surface hardware.
pros: Can fold down completely flat for transporting to any location, but it takes on a comfortable curved shape when you want to use it
Offers a style that will match Microsoft Surface hardware
Makes a Bluetooth connection with the laptop or tablet, which simplifies the process
cons: Scrolling feature doesn't work as smoothly as it should all of the time

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and thin and easy to use (although I miss having a forward/back button near my thumb). Had to adjust to the touch scroll (but you do get an (adjustable) audible click and physical vibration that reaponds to your scrolling touch action). Makes it a bit more familiar. Thin and easy to travel with. Just downloaded the Arc app for my Surface and it worked immediately. Virtually no delay in connecting when I wake up the Surface and "arc" the mouse (turn it on). And I shopped Amazon Warehouse deals; the box was a bit hammered but saved over 50%, and the unit was fine; haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: tmoney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Well made low profile mouse. Flexing the mouse to its curved position turns it on and snapping it flat turns it off. If I had any sort of problem with the mouse it would be that it does not sleep at all. You just have to snap it flat if you want it off and curve it if you want it on. Outside of that its great. You can even program the speed of the touch screen sensor and apply macros to the buttons depending on what software is open.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Honestly a bit overpriced but worth the rating
customer_reviews.text: IMO this was the BEST arc mouse design ever, hence being willing to pay more than I normally would. The original arc required a usb nano transceiver to work which was reasonable when it came out. Later (after I bought that orig model) they came out with a Bluetooth based version for the next generation. Clean, smooth, responsive, easy to install, and rarely looses connection, though it can sometimes be slow to connect/reconnect following sleep/hibernate modes.
customer_reviews.author: Bishop Baconator

customer_reviews.title: Mouse is great and I like the on/off feature
customer_reviews.text: Mouse is great and I like the on/off feature. The one problem I had was the scroll would randomly stop working. I had to turn off and on to get it back. Of course, I searched the forums and found that there was a mouse app for this product and installing fixed my issue or at least made it less of a problem. I normally would mark it down for this, but the app restored the 5th star due to its reverse scolling feature, so now the mouse scroll works like my touch pad (and old macs) and the tablet swipes. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: adugas

customer_reviews.title: Consistent Performance for this Surface Pro 3 User
customer_reviews.text: I have a Surface Pro 3. I searched a b t for a mouse to use with hat machine. While this had a few negative reviews on it using it's bluetooth connection, I have not experienced any issues with it. I find it easy to use and works consistently well. That said, I'm more of a power keyboard user and use a mouse for limited interactions. Iif you use a mouse exclusively, I wouldn't rely on this review.
customer_reviews.author: MJR_Mpls

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working, and yes, I've changed the batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these - and both have experienced the same thing that many have mentioned - just stopped working one day. I've even put in new batteries... (always lit up blue, but changed the batteries anyway) Bluetooth is working on Surface... I've tried flexing/unflexing - turning on/off the mouse (this has worked in the past, but no longer) Nothing. Arms up in the air.
customer_reviews.author: The Mitchells

customer_reviews.title: Slim but unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Great slim profile to match the Surface, but the mouse just isn't reliable enough. The touch scroll-wheel stops working after the mouse is on for a bit, requiring a "reboot" of the mouse. I shouldn't have to reboot a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Rhea

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it connects to my Surface via bluetooth. It has a left and right button as well as a center scroll "wheel." My only problem with the mouse is it makes a noise when I scroll and I can't figure out how to turn it off. Otherwise, it works great and glides smoothly. It's also nice and compact for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this mouse as it is convenient to carry but the truth is after I had the 1st purchased replaced the 2nd one is having the same issue. The scroll working intermittently and sticks more regularly that not. It's functionality is more frustrating than it's worth and unfortunately now I can't return the replacement. So I'm out the money I spent on this one as well as the money for a new mouse. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine on Laptop w/Intel Network 7260.HMWG.R Revised WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse to use on my Alienware laptop, not a surface. I purchased this, rather than the other Arc mouse options, since this one does not need an included adaptor, and has the benefit of being a low-powered mouse for extended battery life. Looking at the general specs, I could see that it should pair with my wireless card. My laptop uses an Intel Network 7260.HMWG.R Revised WiFi Wireless-AC 7260 H/T Dual Band 2x2 AC+Bluetooth on a Windows 10 OS. I opened the Windows 10 Bluetooth settings, it began searching and I pressed the Sync button on the mouse. The laptop found the mouse immediately and paired without issue.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cupit

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is the perfect companion to the surface laptops
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is the perfect companion to the surface laptops. It travels well with its flat to curved design and it functions amazingly. It lasts forever on a good battery and glides well on almost all surfaces. The only issue I ever have with it is slight lack of comfornt using it for so long because my whole hand doesn't fit on it. It's not a huge problem and wouldn't stop me from using it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: MissBlinou

customer_reviews.title: This is a cool portable mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool portable mouse. I don't care who you are. Not sure how long batteries last because 6 months in and original batteries still going strong. Comfortable in my hand to use. Also love how it collapses flat while not in use for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Maurer

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Issues with Surface Pro 4
customer_reviews.text: Ironically, this "surface" edition just doesn't work correctly with the surface pro 4 because of bluetooth issues. Just about every time my sp4 wakes up from sleep mode, this mouse stops working, even though it still shows as being connected in settings. This requires me to turn bluetooth off and on...sometimes several times, to get it working again. Same thing occurs after reboot. Others have reported the same issue, and there does not appear to be a fix at this time. I purchased a second mouse thinking that my first one may have been defective, but the second one has experienced the same problems. It's a shame, because otherwise this would be a great mouse.
customer_reviews.author: James Johnston

customer_reviews.title: I'll be buying these forever.
customer_reviews.text: Don't make the mistake of buying the version with the USB dongle. I did (My mistake-I thought I was buying the Bluetooth version). This one works great and it free's up the one (of two) USB ports. It occasionally needs to be powered off (flattened) then turned back on. If you have a problem with that...tough because you can fold-up your laptop, flatten this mouse and put it in a pocket, grab your coffee with the other hand, and go to your next meeting. I'll be buying these forever.
customer_reviews.author: Ian C. Chin

customer_reviews.title: Well, it's got the cool factor!
customer_reviews.text: Cool Mouse, looks great and I like showing it to people. It works and travels well with my SurfaceBook. A great feature that it turns off when flattened out, but that is about it. I don't find it all that comfortable to use. It is very light and really doesn't fit well in my small hands. I would never consider this as full time mouse, strictly a travel mouse at best, and a very expensive one at that.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite mouse ever! I have really large hands and most mice do not fit comfortably in my hands when utilizing them 8+ hours per day. I usually end up squishing my hand up to fit on the mice correctly which causes hand cramps over time. This mouse fits my hand perfectly, is bluetooth connecting, and takes up very little space. When folded flat, it turns off the mouse causing no extra battery usage. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: love the design and battery life of this mouse - ...
customer_reviews.text: love the design and battery life of this mouse - my only complaint is that the scroll function seems to loose sync frequently and I often have to flatten it out (to turn it off) and turn it back on to re-sync - however, the mouse/pointer doesn't loose connection... I will say that it takes some getting used to...
customer_reviews.author: 2loki4u

customer_reviews.title: Surface User Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I had a Microsoft small travel mouse that worked well but from time to time it had connection issues and it was a bit small. I saw a fellow Surface Pro user using one of these mice and after trying it out I had to have one. I absolutely love the size and it doesn't have the connection issue the other one had. I highly recommend this for those persons traveling a bit or are Surface users.
customer_reviews.author: Phenom13

customer_reviews.title: arc is very comfortable for the hand/wrist
customer_reviews.text: Pros: portable, instantly works when bent to turn on, decent clickyness of the keys, very premium feel, does work on all surfaces. Cons: arc is very comfortable for the hand/wrist, scroll wheel is terrible (rather than precise and proportional, it's just swipe = set interval of scroll clicks), the "haptic feedback" is just the speaker which is obnoxious, and to top it off, the precision of the mouse itself for tracking is no good w/ loud scraping on hard surface (i.e. can work on any surface but better to have a mousepad). Overall: would not recommend. I find that using the trackpad on the SP4 keyboard cover works much much better
customer_reviews.author: Alex Chang

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bluetooth mouse for on the go mobile professionals!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse for Surface Pro users. The big difference in the Surface edition is it's Bluetooth, so it saves that precious single USB port in the Surface Pro. Since it's barely more expensive, I recommend it highly for any user. No power switch. It folds flat. Once you unfold it to the curved position, it's own. The strip in the middle is useful for scrolling. And folding / unfolding it repeatedly is the killer feature when you're in a boring meeting and need to distract yourself but it's not appropriate to check email or pull out your phone. Been using it for months and I can say that the battery life is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: The bluetooth connection has been flawless for me in the 2 weeks I have had the mouse. I had purchased a USB version for another computer some time ago, so I already knew the mouse was comfortable for my small hand. Not a lot of buttons, and the scroll wheel can go crazy if you are not careful, but it works for me. My hand and wrist do not get stressed during the hours I spend doing research on the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This mouse needs a real scrolling wheel to make it usable.
customer_reviews.text: This would be a good product if it had an actual wheel for scrolling but instead it has a touchpad strip that is next to unusable. Touching this strip often causes the screen to scroll up one page and I needed to repeatedly scroll back down to find my place again. I consider this mouse not ready for customer use and is a waste of $55. I thought I may be able to get used to this, this piece of crap....but all it did was made me cuss worse than I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great mouse, blew away expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, I gave a Surface full bundle to somebody before, and I liked it enough to get one for myself. I have hands that usually prefer large mice but I have no problem using this one. The haptic middle wheel is great, it works well, I do not find myself making mistakes at all. I got used to the "double middle click" really fast too. Not a problem. It's been through a few plane rides, so I'm confident about its durability at this point, and it's compact when you flatten it. Amazingly... I haven't lost it yet either.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzhao

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable functionality
customer_reviews.text: Nice collapsible mouse for travel, but one incredibly annoying problem is the unreliability of the "scroll wheel" functionality. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. It should work on web pages and in Word docs for scrolling pages, for instance, and it usually does; but on other web pages or in other docs it simply does nothing at all. Also, there are times when it just stops communicating, and you have to collapse the mouse and then re-bend it into an arc again. It's an irritating problem for a mouse that costs $80.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Jabroni

customer_reviews.title: Updated 5-29-18
customer_reviews.text: Works w/ my 2016 acer aspire R. Buttons aren't stiff at all. Bluetooth is an awesome feature. Works spectacular. It's kind of long for my small hands, but I think I will make this work. I've had product a yr. now. I still like it. I took a star because it loses its bluetooth signal a lot. I'm still using and I like it. 1yr. 5 mths. of constant use... Mouse has a major flaw its not sturdy enough. Mine has broken in the end of the bend where the battery starts. It just got worn out from turning off and on. I really love the concept of this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: A must for anyone needed a portable mouse for Windows tablets.
customer_reviews.text: Finally bluetooth in the mouse! I have owned the prior model which requires the use of a USB toggle transmitter which drove me crazy as when using that configuration on a tablet meant that the one and only USB port was then taken. No more! I have the Microsoft Tablet 3 512GB configuration and this mouse works perfectly. Also have a second Arc bluetooth mouse which I use with my Lenovo Tablet 2 8 inch Windows tablet and also works great Mouse is nice and slim when not being used and feels good in the hand if if you have larger hands like me (6'3, 205lbs)! Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: BorderBuyer_com

customer_reviews.title: Best travel mouse, but some cons
customer_reviews.text: Love the form factor, in fact after I got used to it I felt like it was the best mobile mouse ever. Fold flat design stows neatly into backpack. The only issue, and it's a big one for me, is the rumble response for the scroll "wheel" touch area just stops after a short period of time. This has happened on more than one of these!!! The only way I've been able to fix is by turning it off and back on... like 8 times a day. Awesome product, just wish it worked correctly all the time.
customer_reviews.author: GrizzA

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent mouse. Takes just a little getting used to
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent mouse. Takes just a little getting used to, but its portability compensates for everything. The scroll wheel isn't mechanical -- the mouse imitates it very well (it even makes a realistic clicking sound / haptic feedback). Can't comment on the battery life -- I've had it for a month now, and it's still going strong after my using it for a few hours a day. It has a major cool factor. People will grab this thing from you and bend it a few times to see how this works.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is stylish and great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is stylish and great for traveling. The arching on/off design is genius and makes for simple power saving mechanics. It's extremely ergonomic and the materials are very soft. I do worry about long term wear and tear. I don't think the outside will still be pretty six months to a year from now. My only real complaint is the scroll wheel. It's some sort of capacitive touch scroll wheel and it's finicky to say the least. Overall, it's a good buy at the price if you're looking from something compact and stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Masonrock

customer_reviews.title: I like the haptic feel of it
customer_reviews.text: A very convenient mouse, since you can flatten it, it suits smaller laptop covers which have a small pocket. The problem is sometimes it doesn't handle itself well on certain surfaces, I have to find a book to use it on, especially reflective surfaces. I wished there was a way to turn off the sound when you're scrolling. I like the haptic feel of it, but the sound gets a little annoying if you prefer the quiet sound of the keyboard/mouse. Very convenient, but not ergonomic. Would I recommend it? Absolutely, as long as you know why you're getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Duniyadnd

customer_reviews.title: I tried to like this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I tried to like this mouse. It was a convo starter at first, but I stopped using it because of how annoying it got to actually move around. The aesthetics and concept is a good idea on paper, but not ideal for heavy mouse users imo.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Arc Touch is a great little mouse
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and is a great compliment to the Surface. The only 'odd' thing about it is the digital 'clicking' sound it makes when you use the scroll function. No volume control for it, however, there is an app you can download from the store that allows you to turn the sound off if it's too annoying (which I did). I really like the on/off feature of the mouse by simply bending it flat (off for storage) or bending it to an arc (on) to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kento

customer_reviews.title: VERY NEAT MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: It is incredible how far technology is coming. I think this is super neat! My husband brings his SP4 everywhere with him and so having a mouse that flattens in 1 second is just amazing! Super thin (for a mouse) and still sturdy! It still has the options like a regular mouse, like double tapping the middle piece to open a new page or scrolling up and down. It was super easy to connect to the SP4 as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Great portable mouse
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mom and her Surface 3 Pro. Very happy. Easy to pair, simple on/off when you flatten and arch the back. Fits well in a slim laptop bag without bulging. Great to not need to use a USB port like the non-Bluetooth version. Vibration on the scroll touch pad felt weird the first time I used it because I wasn't expecting it to be so crisp, but honestly, it feels like an old school click wheel which I kind of liked.
customer_reviews.author: Dissenter

customer_reviews.title: Beware of dirty mice
customer_reviews.text: The mouse itself is great--I much prefer the texture difference on the scroll "wheel" to the newest version. The problem I had is the mouse was really scratched and worn. It was definitely well-used. Also, I found it sticky. Like when you remove a sticker but there's still residue. Anyway, it'll wear off eventually.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Arc Touch Mouse Surface Edition Review
customer_reviews.text: I have found this mouse great for use with my Surface Pro 3. It is very easy to slip into the Surface carrying case so I don't have to leave behind when I travel. This is important because I have very luggage space when traveling (one carry-on bag when flying, two small saddle bags on my motorcycle). That said the product is bluetooth and paired with no difficulty. It works smoothly on any surface I have tried it on. I would recommend this product to others. I've only had it a short time, so I will post an update if required.
customer_reviews.author: bt129

customer_reviews.title: Obviously the very smart and compact profile is the major selling point and ...
customer_reviews.text: Obviously the very smart and compact profile is the major selling point and I have no problems connecting this nice little thing with my desktop and laptops. Though the underwhelming use experience is the price to pay for mobility and design merits. I would only recommend this as a temporary alternative for a serious mouse/trackpad while travelling, especially if you are suffering from carpel tunnel syndrome like me and have to rely on ergonomically-designed devices most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Rljones

customer_reviews.title: Works Well Overall
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like the feel and function of this mouse. But it has connectivity issues every once in a while for no apparent reason. Could be my surface but they're both microsoft products so I'm not sure what's happening. But it scrolls smooth and clicks nicely. The fold feature is pretty cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic mouse for the Surface
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic mouse for the Surface. It doesn't have a USB Dongle, which is great because my Surface Pro 3 only has one USB port. It connects using Bluetooth. When I'm running PowerPoint slides and have the surface hooked to a projector, I also have a USB dongle inserted for my wireless presenter remote. This way, I can still have a mouse attached if I need to use it to bring up a website, etc... during a presentation. Great product. I wouldn't recommend it for a desktop computer as there are move comfortable mice that work better, but for what it is intended, it is stellar.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: While a good concept, and a decent looking product, it's unreliable in its performance. It'll randomly scroll a webpage without pushing a button, the middle button stops working randomly, and to add insult to injury the Microsoft webpage refuses to register this product so I can't even request a return/repair without going through several more steps.
customer_reviews.author: N. K. Reynoso

customer_reviews.title: Traveling mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is my second arc touch for the surface pro 3. I misplaced the first so I had to buy another through amazon. Nothing bad to say about this at all. Connects via BT without any issues. It's comfortable and it stores easily when traveling. If you don't want to drain the batteries you simply flatten it out when not using. Fold back up to reconnect.
customer_reviews.author: Lue

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is such a handy accessory for my Surface Pro 4. I do a lot of design work on my Surface and using the keyboard's touchpad is just too tedious, so I bought this handy device. The mouse was easy to connect at first and every time I "snap" it to turn it on it connects and is ready to use almost instantly. I love the slim profile and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Best small mouse for travel
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the one that came with my MS Surface Pro 3. My mouse was lost in a move. It's lightweight, and perfect for travel. It does seem to disconnect from your tablet or laptop every once in a while. It's just a matter of going into your Bluetooth setting. Just a small annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Betheny

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to stow, easy to use. Nice feature set. No mini dongle since it uses BT! and Since its a full size mouse, much better in hand feel than those micro mice. I hate track pads, so this thing is great. I knock it one star for two reasons. The rubber portion on the back half of the mouse is a dust and particle magnet. Like it always has a static charge on it. Wiping it clean is a PITA at times. Secondly is the price. 10$ more than the original? come on! I still bought it so the price obviously didn't bother me that much but still. Both minor gripes on what is the best portable mouse ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: When you need a minimal mouse that saves space, and keeps your usb slots open, this is it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Surface 2 and carried it over to my surface 3. It is very minimal. No buttons for back in the browser or anything like that. Sometimes I just need a little precision and speed that I canot get from the mouse pad built on the surface. This fills the gap. It is very thin while in my bag. I carry a small and minimal bag as it barely fits my computer, and this does not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O'Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Responsive, Smooth, Fold Flat Mouse for MS Surface Pro
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Mouse for use with my Surface Pro 4 Tablet because it folds flat and takes up very little space in my carrying case from Case Logic. This Mouse is very responsive for a Bluetooth device. I have not had the experience of previous reviewers with any hesitancy when the Mouse "wakes up" after minutes of non-use. Also, it is very comfortable in my hand and glides very smoothly over both a mouse pad and bare wood. I highly recommend this Mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Sale Ed

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse, with occasional connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: Using this with a Surface 4 Pro device. I occasionally have issues where the bluetooth association between the mouse and the tablet breaks. At this point the connected devices under bluetooth indicates that there is a driver error. Not sure if this a tablet problem or a mouse problem. I have yet to get to a Microsoft Store to have one of their folks dig into this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Davies

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless mouse I've used in the last 10 years or so
customer_reviews.text: On my third Arc Touch mouse.. one for work and one for home.. the first was bought the day they were released and hands down this is the best wireless mouse line I've used in the last 10 years. Especially now that they've finally adopted blue tooth, no more wireless adapter to suck up a USB port. Battery life seems longer on the BT version as well. Nothing empirical just based on daily office usage and often forgetting to flatten (turn off) it before leaving for the day.
customer_reviews.author: C.Floyd

customer_reviews.title: So Close to Excellence
customer_reviews.text: It's a great concept. I'm a bit impressed at the touch scroll feature and the relative precision of a Bluetooth mouse. However, there are times when I move it slightly to get the cursor to move accordingly and it doesn't move initially and, instead, jumps about three times the distance I intended. It's mildly annoying so far but I suspect that the inconvenience could grow in profundity over time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Davis

customer_reviews.title: The perfect mobile mouse for business purposes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for my Surface, just for having the "Surface" word on it, but knowing that Microsoft makes really great hardware. I've been using it for around a month and works perfectly. You don't need much space to take it with you, and don't even imagine the face of the other when you bring it to the table ;) You just need to configure if you want or don't want any scroll sound. You'll love this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Pefect portable mouse
customer_reviews.text: I'm a dedicated trackball user and don't like mice. Then why am I giving this 5 stars. Because I travel, and need a small, portable mouse (I just can't use trackpads on any laptop, for whatever reason, they don't make the mouse pointer go anywhere near where I want it to go). This mouse is just amazing. So small, folds flat (so fits in my laptop case), responsive, and looks great. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Londonnoise

customer_reviews.title: ... he recently got a surface and he was so happy. It flattens up and slides right into his ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Father's Day gift for my husband since he recently got a surface and he was so happy. It flattens up and slides right into his case that he puts in his work bag. These are the newest, coolest mice out there!
customer_reviews.author: police

customer_reviews.title: Mouse is very portable and works great. Took 1 star off for what has to ...
customer_reviews.text: Using with a 2013 Macbook Pro. Mouse is very portable and works great. Took 1 star off for what has to be done to turn off that (annoying) artificial clicking noise the scroll sensor makes! Almost took 2 stars but didn't want to fault the product simply because I didn't have a readily available Windows 8 or newer machine to install the application from the Microsoft Store.
customer_reviews.author: GetLikeBeej

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for desktop applications and easy storage.
customer_reviews.text: Works well on flat surfaces. Scroll kind of hard to find sometimes and definitely not a mouse you can "hold" very well but perfect for desktop application. Love the storage ability to fold flat and it turns off automatically. Not great for weird surfaces but for normal use it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Watson

customer_reviews.title: This is a good mouse for travel/school use
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mouse for travel/school use, it looks great and has a clever design, and works great with the Surface Pro 4. However I have medium-large hands and this mouse is a little small to use for extended periods of time for me. It is not very wide. Also the scrolling is a little hit or miss as some have noted, I often accidentally click on the scrolling button, or have trouble finding it. The click is loud but I don't really mind.
customer_reviews.author: PY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...when it actually worked
customer_reviews.text: Very upset with the quality of this mouse. I purchased this October 2nd in 2015 and as of July 26th of 2016 it has completely stopped working. When it worked, it worked great, but often times I found myself having to snap it back to flat to reset it so the scroll would work. The design and everything is awesome, it just needs some fine tuning and should last for years and years instead of well under 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Portable and functional but did not last.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped powering on altogether after 14 months of use. Microsoft wouldn't offer any kind of replacement or discount because it was 2 months out of warranty. If I am going to be paying extra for a 'premium' product, then I expect it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. This is a Bluetooth mouse, and set up was a breeze. So far, the operation is flawless. Its very responsive, moves seamlessly, and looks great. What I love about it most, is how it can lay flat to turn it off, which makes transporting it super convenient. Great little mouse and surface accessory for you surface product.
customer_reviews.author: danebramage

customer_reviews.title: Great design and great product
customer_reviews.text: I got this type of mouse with my Surface Pro III at work so when I purchased a new laptop for home I purchased this. These are great - connect every time, long battery life, slim and easy to pack when traveling, works on just about any surface and has great feel and feedback when using. I work on spreadsheets ALL the time and this is a great shape and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Scroll is sensitive. Occasional connection issue
customer_reviews.text: Love that it turns on when curved and off when flatten. Has occasionally required me to set up again as lost connection with computer. The scroll button is overly sensitive and it starts rolling the screen on my, hopefully just a setting I have to adjust...
customer_reviews.author: MDH

customer_reviews.title: For a portable mouse, it's really only useful on desk (and not a glass one).
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work on jeans or any surface that isn't perfectly level and fairly hard. The shape is uncomfortable and awkward. I don't use it and consider it a waste of money and a purchase that I regret (but can't return it now). The idea is good, but the execution is poor. I don't recommend it for anyone with CTS either.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Couey

customer_reviews.title: I like the portability of this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I like the portability of this mouse, but it otherwise sucks. The "scroll wheel" stops working all the time and I have to turn it off and back on again to get it to work right. I read a few hundred complaints on the Microsoft KB without a single response from MS.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D Cluxton

customer_reviews.title: Great PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: Great Mouse, very slim. I hadn't realized it goes flat to turn it off. Amazing tool and easy to store in your tablet case pocket. It's not quick at scrolling down because it clicks for each scroll swipe with your finger. This is a non issue because I use my finger to scroll down habitually.. I highly recommend this mouse to anyone with a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Angee

customer_reviews.title: Good feel in the hand.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good feel in the hand. "Scrolling" feature very cool. Second purchase. The first one lasted 6 ish years so good lifetime. Be aware that Bluetooth technology limits the mouse to one device at a time (ex a laptop) and must be disconnected before reconnecting to a different device (i.e. Second laptop)
customer_reviews.author: Esther H

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchasing a Surface for work and I missed having a mouse. I started looking at all that were available, this seemed to the best on the market. Reviews were amazing. Definitely the best purchase! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product, but great idea.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second arc mouse. My first one died, and we could not bring it back to life. This second one broke only after a week (about 5 times) of using it. It is a great mouse when you get one that works. The tip at the end of the mouse broke off, so now it doesn't move on any surface. So annoying.
customer_reviews.author: KKLDesigns

customer_reviews.title: these are awesome mice.
customer_reviews.text: The only issue with this is the center "track pad" used to simulate the wheel stops working on occasion. This is the second one I've had and they both do it. You just have to flatten the mouse out (which turns it off) and bend it back to the curve. seems to reset it and it goes back to working. Other than that, these are awesome mice.
customer_reviews.author: Lon L.

customer_reviews.title: As with other poor reviews - it just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: As with other poor reviews - it just stopped working. I used for 10 months w/ my Surface then one day just wouldn't move cursor on screen. I verified power to device, verified it was connected to computer, and all the usual trouble shooting including new batteries, restarting computer, powering mouse off, etc. For the price I paid I would expect more. The feel of it IS nice though and the "popping" flat and curved to turn off/on is cool. Just expect it may stop working one day.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie W.

customer_reviews.title: now for years and love it. The bluetooth version works perfectly also
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mouse, and the USB equivalent, now for years and love it. The bluetooth version works perfectly also. Takes a little getting used to but then you'll appreciate the design and portability. I've recommended it to many people at work and have purchased many for their laptops, everyone loves it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David Eisenberg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse. Folds completely flat for travel
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mouse. Folds completely flat for travel. Bluetooth is pretty solid, and means no stupid nano-receiver usb that gets lost. The only major con with it is that the middle mouse click is a bit weird. You have to double-tap, so this means middle-click and dragging is really awkward. Other than that, scrolling is great, although the options cant seem to be configured like the regular USB arc mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I thought this will be a good mouse to carry in my laptop bag
customer_reviews.text: This mouse caught my attention because, when unfolded / turned off, it is flat. I thought this will be a good mouse to carry in my laptop bag. It does unfold to flat form and is easier to store and carry in my bag, however, it is not as ergonomic or easy to use as Logitech M510 that I use with my company's laptop or MS Notebook Mouse 5000 that I used before Arc Mouse. My hand gets tired and cramped easily. Arc mouse also does not have buttons or gestures to move back and forward between pages. I am about to order Logitech MX Anywhere 2 mouse to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Joon H Lee

customer_reviews.title: I love that it has an awesome design and it's extremely ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Arc Touch mouse to use with my Surface 3. I love that it has an awesome design and it's extremely portable since you can flatten it to travel (and power off). The sensor on it has been accurate and it functions well. The only issue I've encountered with the mouse is that occasionally the scroll function ceases to work. This can be fixed easily by turning it off and on again, but it can be inconvenient and mildly irritating having to do that every so often. But overall it's been a great mouse that frees up the USB slot for me to use on my Surface 3.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: I love the design
customer_reviews.text: I love the design. I love the functionality of folding it flat. I had one of these before (not the "surface edition". It was fantastic. This one started falling apart and plastic parts breaking as soon as I unwrapped it. The first touch to the desk, more plastic broke. Mine is now glued and taped together. My assumption is that a different material was used on this version as I had NO problems with the previous version. DO NOT BUY THIS ONE.
customer_reviews.author: jim shook

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy the fact that this mouse is versatile
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy the fact that this mouse is versatile. it truly will work on any surface. When they carpet or even your bed sheet or comforter, they mean it. I love that it hooks up easily via Bluetooth. The scroll function is a little sensitive until you get to it. It is definitely convenient in size and easy to carry anywhere. All the basic functions you need in a mouse and comfortable in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: dolphinjen14

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for the Surface Pro 4 or Surface Book
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this mouse. The "click" noise that most complain about can be easily quieted or even turned off with the Arc Mouse App on the surface. The mouse is smooth and comfortable and easy to store in the laptop sleeve with the surface. Makes playing games and browsing much better!
customer_reviews.author: Maral T.

customer_reviews.title: I really love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mouse, I love the feel of it and if you are the type of person with long fingers and likes to just use your finger tips to guide the mouse then you should find this very comfortable as well. But it ONLY works on Windows 8, the worst operating system existnce, it will not work on Mac, Linux or Windows 7 and down. Also within a month the scroll stopped working properly, if you try to scroll down it will jump up and down and scroll up.
customer_reviews.author: David Shaheen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice....so far
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved this mouse today so my review is based on a very short time of usuing it. I absolutely love this mouse. It paired up very quicly and all functions work perfectly. Some people talk about a lag with a bluetooth mouse but I am not noticing one at all. I would highly reccomend this mouse if you use your surface like a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: R. Story

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for the Surface
customer_reviews.text: This mouse was extremely easy to configure with Windows 8.1 and I am using it with a Lenovo Helix. The mouse stores nearly flat (there is s slight bump where the "internals" are located and turns on when you bend it into an arch. The battery life is extremely long and the mouse is responsive. It contains the two buttons and a slider for easy scrolling. Worthwhile buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rohde

customer_reviews.title: Great travel accessory, but the wheel doesn't work well on mine.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse for any traveler. I got it for my Surface Pro 3. The touchpad on my Type cover works well, but sometimes you just want a mouse, you know? My only complaint with the product is that the mouse "wheel" doesn't seem to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: I love this little mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this little mouse, it fits perfectly in my hand without causing fatigue. It paired with my Surface Pro quickly and leaves my USB port free for other uses. The flatten to turn off feature is great I don't need to worry about leaving it on accidently and finding dead batteries when I need it most. When it is flattened it takes very little space, making it perfect for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Feel Is Awkward
customer_reviews.text: As you can imagine, a device like this is more about convenience and portability, and less about comfort and functionality. I'm not a fan of it, but I use it on the road and in away meetings. The whole Surface concept is a series of poor compromises--and I hate my Surface Pro 3, and the Dock even worse. Fortunately, the whole mess belongs to my company and I didn't purchase it myself--thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Will Corsair

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the scroll wheel
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of the scroll wheel. I like the use the wheel press to automatically open link in a new tab. There is no actual press, you have to double tap the scroll button which isn't easy without looking at the mouse. I rarely get it on the first attempt and retrying gets annoying. Otherwise, the mouse is nice and portable. Tracks well on a variety of surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B Case

customer_reviews.title: so love the style and sleekness of it and how wonderful ...
customer_reviews.text: so love the style and sleekness of it and how wonderful it is that it lays flat to store. I also love how it turns on and off automatically from the flat position. The scrolling functionality does take some getting use to. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dhpdhp

customer_reviews.title: it is nice. Slim and great for my travel bag
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it is nice. Slim and great for my travel bag. However, it never ever ever ever works when I first start up. Everytime I start my computer and turn on this POS mouse, I have to run the troubleshooter and restart my computer. After that, it works fine. Wish I never bought this
customer_reviews.author: B Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love the mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love the mouse. Wish it could pair with more than one device at a time. Seems like that should be the norm these days. The Logitech Ultrathin Touch Mouse T630 will pair with two devices. The Logitech Bluetooth Multi-Device Keyboard K480 will pair with 3 devices. I would have loved to be able to pair this with at least two devices.
customer_reviews.author: RSinChandler

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and I like the design
customer_reviews.text: Very wonky with a Microsoft Surface book and ergonomically uncomfortable. Great for travel and I like the design, but skipped quite a bit which is probably the Surface Book, but still sad being both Microsoft. Don't use it after 30 days of trying to get used to it and having it not skip and jump reloading drivers several times.
customer_reviews.author: TallRents

customer_reviews.title: Great companion to my Surface Pro 4
customer_reviews.text: Great companion to my Surface Pro 4. Connects automatically when you bend it. Takes up much less room than a regular mouse. Update: The mouse scrolling will sometimes stop working. If I turn off and back on it will start working again. Deducting a star.
customer_reviews.author: MarkyMark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, connected fine, literally everything as it should be. No complaints yet.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Works very well even though it is expensive
customer_reviews.text: connects via Bluetooth keeping the USB port free. Already owned the Surface Arc mouse with dongle so this was a natural choice. Work flawlessly too so what not to like except the price. A bit pricey it is...
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: A microsoft product so good you'd think Apple designed it.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy Bluetooth 4.0 connection provides precision tracking and long battery life. Swaps easily between the Bluetooth connections of my PC and tablet and it's ability to "flatten" and simultaneously power off provides easy storage in a laptop bag or tablet case.
customer_reviews.author: ashemonia

customer_reviews.title: Alright, not great, but it works
customer_reviews.text: small and portable, check. works as directed, check. gives you a solid sense of movement and control over your mouse on a SP4 Pro i7 rig... not really. it's great for what it is, but it could be a lot better - tracking jumps a little, occasional input delay can get annoying, and I really wish the two function button where touch as well so I could continue using swipe gestures.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: The design is great, but the center slider panel which is supposed ...
customer_reviews.text: The design is great, but the center slider panel which is supposed to function as a scroll wheel loses Bluetooth connectivity often, even after I've verified that the cursor is placed on the part of the screen that I want to scroll. I find I have to turn the mouse off and on way too many times each day to get the slider panel working again. It's frustrating because this is a very nice mouse other than that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!!
customer_reviews.text: I am the type of guy that can't get used to the laptop trackpad so I always have to buy a mouse. One of my friends showed me this so I thought it was pretty neat and bought it for myself to use for work and home. Absolutely pleased! Very easy to use, ergonomic (once you get used to it) and will work on almost every surface I've tried so far. It's also ultra portable so it easily fits into my work bag for travel Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Nirtej Wadwa

customer_reviews.title: Mouse stops working randomly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in December 2015. It has issues with just not working, so you bend it back and forth until it wakes up and decides to work. Batteries have been changed and I have reset the Bluetooth. Still wants to crap out without any good reason. Kind of a pain, and I expected it to work all the time.
customer_reviews.author: MRBH

customer_reviews.title: Great to travel
customer_reviews.text: Great to travel, packs easily and is well built. Bluetooth connection is usually pretty good, and I'm able to plug the computer into the TV and use the mouse from the couch. Quickly connects to Bluetooth and is easy to use. I've had some issues with the scroll "wheel" however, in that it will sometimes cut out and not function properly. Turning the mouse on and off again solves the problem, but it's definitely inferior to a mechanical wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to go with my new Surface and absolutely love the slim, compact, and stream-lined modern design of this most excellent wireless mouse. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Minier

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse to travel with!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse! I love how portable it is, and it really is an awesome concept! It takes a little getting used to since it does not have full sides like a traditional mouse but once you get past that it is perfect. I would recommend this if you are thinking about getting it!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: The design and use of this mouse is more innovative than a lot of things I have seen from Microsoft. I do not like the violent SNAPPING sound the mouse makes when you go to use it, but I suppose it will wear out somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Innovative yes, but uncomfortable to the hand very much ...
customer_reviews.text: Innovative yes, but uncomfortable to the hand very much so. The left and right clicks are stiff and short, located at the tip of the device. If you have short fingers you are out of luck. Prepare to have cramping hands. The middle button is hit or miss. Scrolling is surprisingly satisfying at first until that first random middle click occurs.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: This is the best mouse for my travel bag
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mouse for my travel bag. When you flatten it out, it hardly takes up any space in my bag and the power turns automatically off, saving the battery. It turns on again when you "bend" it back to the working shape. It take 2 standard AAA cells and they seem to be lasting quite well - so far three months of heavy use and still going strong. I am using it with my MS Surface Pro as well as my MacBook Air and it links to both computers without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Rolf Schimmer

product_meta.title: Microsoft Arc Touch Mouse Surface Edition
product_meta.description:
ARC TOUCH MOUSE SURFACE EDITION

Inspired by Surface, this special edition mouse is uniquely designed for life on the go.


CLICK ON THE CURVE.
Simply curve the mouse to power it on, and flatten to power off. Then, toss it into your pocket or bag. Plus, you can you use the Arc Touch Mouse just about anywhere, like rough wood surfaces and carpet — even up to 30 feet away. It’s the perfect solution for portable productivity.


FEATURES
 * Comfortable, elegant and eye-catching, this mouse is designed for quick use and easy storage. Just curve the mouse gently to get started. And when you’re done, power down by flattening it out.
 * Use BlueTrack Technology on virtually any surface, from rough wood to carpet.
 * Responding precisely to the speed of your finger movement, the Touch Strip scans through documents or web pages entirely by feel.
 * Choose from two ways to scroll, with your finger movement or in the opposite direction with 2-Way Touch Scrolling.
 * Bluetooth 4.0 Wireless Connectivity works with Surface and other (SmartReady) Bluetooth 4.0-enabled PCs and tablets.


Supported Platforms: Surface with Windows RT, Windows 8 Pro, Windows 8.1 and Windows 8.1 Pro Dimensions: 2.25" / 57mm x 5.12" / 130mm x .57" / 14.5mm Weight: 2.29 oz. Connector Type: Bluetooth 
2013 Microsoft Inc. All rights reserved.
feature_bullets: Styled to match Surface, the Mouse boasts a sleek dark titanium finish.
The award-winning design of Arc Touch was created with a mobile lifestyle in mind.
When in use, this stylish piece of ingenuity shapes to the natural curve of your hand. And when you’re done, just flatten it out for easy storage in your pocket or bag.
Connects wirelessly with Bluetooth for a clutter-free experience.
Superior comfort that's designed to fit your right or left hand.
Works on virtually any surface with BlueTrack Technology.
